page.title: 06Employment, Eaton B & Totter
page.content: Although most people work outside the villages, there is still some employment to be found at the cement quarries near Totternhoe and in the villages. Richard Grant's factory in Eaton Bray employs nearly 80 people, approx half of whom are local, making car accessories which are exported to all parts of the world. Nearby, Paddy Hopkirk's Motor Accessories factory at Two Counties Mill, employs about 96 people, again half of them local, making petrol cans, dog guards and roof racks for home and export. Several garages in the area, one of which is the largest sales and spares centre for Jeeps in the UK, employ people in sales and maintenance. Part time work, mainly for women, is found in public houses and their attached restaurants and village shops.
